repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
We only suggest use `vim.diagnostic`  module for diagnostic relate usage. the `vim.lsp.diagnostic` module a little duplicate. now extend get line or cursor diagnostic in `vim.diagnostic.get`  function and support to get original lsp format diagnostic. 

when use `codeacton`  default  handler  in normal mode pass cursor diagnostic to  context.  mark `vim.lsp.diagnostic.get_line_diagnsotics` as `deprecated` and remove some private and not used functions. 

next step we can move some functions in `vim.lsp.diagnsotic` to `vim.lsp.handler` and  `vim.diagnostic` then maybe can remove `vim.lsp.diagnostic` ? keep one `diagnostic` module.

Fix #21985

comment_data.body: Not all diagnostics are LSP diagnostics, and LSP diagnostics should not be treated specially. They are one consumer of possibly many.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -464,7 +464,10 @@ get({bufnr}, {opts})                                    *vim.diagnostic.get()*
                  • namespace: (number) Limit diagnostics to the given
                    namespace.
                  • lnum: (number) Limit diagnostics to the given line number.
+                 • col: (number) Limit diagnsotics to the given column number.
                  • severity: See |diagnostic-severity|.
+                 • original: (boolean) if true the diagnostic use lsp orignial
+                   format.

comment_data.body: `vim.diagnostic` should not have any LSP-isms in it. The `vim.lsp.diagnostic` module serves as the "bridge" between "LSP diagnostics" and the generic `vim.diagnostic` interface. We should not add these here.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -377,6 +377,37 @@ local function clear_scheduled_display(namespace, bufnr)
   end
 end
 
+---@private
+---@param severity lsp.DiagnosticSeverity
+local function severity_vim_to_lsp(severity)
+  if type(severity) == 'string' then
+    severity = vim.diagnostic.severity[severity]
+  end
+  return severity
+end
+
+--- @private
+--- @param diagnostic Diagnostic
+--- @return lsp.Diagnostic[]
+local function diagnostic_vim_to_lsp(diagnostic)
+  return vim.tbl_extend('keep', {
+    range = {
+      start = {
+        line = diagnostic.lnum,
+        character = diagnostic.col,
+      },
+      ['end'] = {
+        line = diagnostic.end_lnum,
+        character = diagnostic.end_col,
+      },
+    },
+    severity = severity_vim_to_lsp(diagnostic.severity),
+    message = diagnostic.message,
+    source = diagnostic.source,
+    code = diagnostic.code,
+  }, diagnostic.user_data and (diagnostic.user_data.lsp or {}) or {})
+end
+

@@ -377,6 +377,37 @@ local function clear_scheduled_display(namespace, bufnr)
   end
 end
 
+---@private
+---@param severity lsp.DiagnosticSeverity
+local function severity_vim_to_lsp(severity)
+  if type(severity) == 'string' then
+    severity = vim.diagnostic.severity[severity]
+  end
+  return severity
+end
+
+--- @private

+local function diagnostic_vim_to_lsp(diagnostic)
+  return vim.tbl_extend('keep', {
+    range = {
+      start = {
+        line = diagnostic.lnum,
+        character = diagnostic.col,
+      },
+      ['end'] = {
+        line = diagnostic.end_lnum,
+        character = diagnostic.end_col,
+      },
+    },
+    severity = severity_vim_to_lsp(diagnostic.severity),
+    message = diagnostic.message,
+    source = diagnostic.source,
+    code = diagnostic.code,
+  }, diagnostic.user_data and (diagnostic.user_data.lsp or {}) or {})
+end
+

comment_data.body: oh make sense I forgot that.  so called lsp instead of original?.or something else
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -464,7 +464,10 @@ get({bufnr}, {opts})                                    *vim.diagnostic.get()*
                  • namespace: (number) Limit diagnostics to the given
                    namespace.
                  • lnum: (number) Limit diagnostics to the given line number.
+                 • col: (number) Limit diagnsotics to the given column number.
                  • severity: See |diagnostic-severity|.
+                 • original: (boolean) if true the diagnostic use lsp orignial
+                   format.

comment_data.body: I don't think we need this new field at all. There is already the `user_data` field, you can check if `user_data.lsp` exists.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -464,7 +464,10 @@ get({bufnr}, {opts})                                    *vim.diagnostic.get()*
                  • namespace: (number) Limit diagnostics to the given
                    namespace.
                  • lnum: (number) Limit diagnostics to the given line number.

                  • severity: See |diagnostic-severity|.
+                 • original: (boolean) if true the diagnostic use lsp orignial

comment_data.body: when this option is true the `vim.diagnostic.get` return the diagnosticwith original lsp format . we can use this in code_action context .
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -464,7 +464,10 @@ get({bufnr}, {opts})                                    *vim.diagnostic.get()*
                  • namespace: (number) Limit diagnostics to the given

comment_data.body: moved it to util.lua and this function could still use some improvements. Implement a two-way conversion from diagnostics to vim and from vim to lsp. This can reduce some private functions in `vim.lsp.diagnsotic`. how do you feel?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -377,6 +377,37 @@ local function clear_scheduled_display(namespace, bufnr)
   end
 end
 
+---@private
+---@param severity lsp.DiagnosticSeverity
+local function severity_vim_to_lsp(severity)
+  if type(severity) == 'string' then
+    severity = vim.diagnostic.severity[severity]
+  end
+  return severity
+end
+
+--- @private
+--- @param diagnostic Diagnostic
+--- @return lsp.Diagnostic[]
+local function diagnostic_vim_to_lsp(diagnostic)
+  return vim.tbl_extend('keep', {
+    range = {
+      start = {
+        line = diagnostic.lnum,
+        character = diagnostic.col,
+      },
+      ['end'] = {
+        line = diagnostic.end_lnum,
+        character = diagnostic.end_col,
+      },
+    },
+    severity = severity_vim_to_lsp(diagnostic.severity),

+    source = diagnostic.source,
+    code = diagnostic.code,
+  }, diagnostic.user_data and (diagnostic.user_data.lsp or {}) or {})
+end

comment_regular_data.body: The whole point of the `vim.diagnostic` refactor was to disentangle the LSP specific concept of diagnostics from a more abstract concept of "diagnostics". This seems like a step backward, as we are re-introducing that coupling and tying together modules that were (with great difficulty) once untied.

Is this still being worked on? I'd like to help fixing the issue. I also noticed that multiline diagnostics "covering" cursor position are not taken into account, not sure if this PR fixes that as well https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/21985#issuecomment-1718773010
